author: wsjcom
title: Getting the Science Right for EPA Regulators
text: Regarding Steve Milloy’s “The EPA Cleans Up Its Science” (op-ed, March 27): Mr. Milloy, who, like EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt, is an attorney, reports that data obtained from death records found that there was no relationship between small-particulate pollution and mortality. It is highly unlikely that such a database could show this, given the minimal amount of information contained on a death certificate. Not the least of the shortcomings of such a study would be that they reflect mortality and not general health effects, such as asthma.
